west_african.text: Earth is but a marketplace; heaven is home.
Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far.
Perhaps you do not understand me because you do not love me.
Silence is also speech.
Sorrow doesn't kill -- reckless joy does.
The teeth that laugh are also those that bite.
What you cannot see during the day, you will not see at night.
When the mouth stumbles, it is worse than the foot.
When the music changes, so does the dance.
A hare is like an ass in the length of its ears, yet it is not its son.
A talkative bird will not build a nest.
A tattler is war than a thief.
At the bottom of patience one finds heaven.
By crawling, a child learns to stand.
Everybody loves a fool, but nobody wants him for a son.
Everybody loves a lord.
Fear is no obstacle to death.
Not to know is bad; not to wish to know is worse.
Loving someone that does not love you is like loving the rain that falls in the forest.
The heart is not a knee, it does not bend.
When a mother has twins she must sleep on her back.
A satisfied person does not know what a hungry one feels.
If you see a man in a gown eating with a man in rags, the food belongs to the latter.
A real family eats the same cornmeal.
Allah does not destroy the men whom one hates.
The child looks everywhere and often sees nought, the old man, sitting on the ground, sees everything.
The house-roof fights with the rain, but he who is sheltered ignores it.
The partridge loves peas, but not those that go into the pot with it.
Those who get on the same pirogue, have the same aspirations.
To love the king is not bad, but a king who loves you is better.
One cannot part two fighting bulls.
When you see a palm tree, the palm tree has seen you.
When you see a turtle on top of a fence post, you know he had some help.
A wrong step by the leader is a warning for those following.
The chicken that digs for food will not sleep hungry.
The rich is never satisfied.
The river may is wide, but it can crossed.
Two hippopotamuses cannot share the same hole.
One cannot borrow a man's mouth and eat onions for him.
When an elephant is dead, a hare will not smell.
By crawling a child learns to stand.
Sorrow doesn’t kill — reckless joy does.
Fear is no obstacle to death.
